column4: why do I get a different behavior when I run a link vs. what the link is pointing to? has anyone had experience with this?
When I run a scr
When I run a script, it works fine... but when I run it via a symbolic link, it crashes. Why would that be?
how are you running your script?
/usr/local/sbin/GCALDaemon/bin/standalone-start.sh
That way works, but using a symbol
ok and have you ran: sudo chmod +x /usr/local/sbin/GCALDaemon/bin/standalone-start.sh
ic link doesn't. ie. ./standalone-start.sh
Sorry, my messages got jumbled. It is executable and runs fine when run directly.
if you add some echo lines to your script, you can see exactly what point it crashes
It is not myscript, and it works fine when not run via symbolic link.
It is a script for GCALDaemon
exactly so you need to find out when it crashes, if you add some echo commands you can output to the terminal, if the outouts stop you know roughly where it dies
shouldn't running a link be the same thing as running it directly? it is throwing a ClassNotFoundException.
is it a symbolic link or a hard link?
Symbolic
strange
edit the script and add some lines that output to stdout so you ca see where it fails
something like: echo "start"      at the start, then after a few lines add       echo "step1"  and so on, when the lines stop writing to the screen you will know at what pint it crashed
It is 2 lines. lol. I think I might know why though. The first line is GCALDIR=`dirname "$0"`/..
you can then use fileroller
sudo apt-get install rar unrar
to extract at command line its: rar x <rar file>
